March 24th is the 365th and last day of the year in many European implementations of the [[Julian calendar]].

==Events==
*[[1401]] &ndash; [[Turko-Mongol]] emperor [[Timur]] sacks [[Damascus]].
*[[1603]] &ndash; [[James I of England|James VI of Scotland]] also becomes James I of England, upon the death of [[Elizabeth I of England|Elizabeth I]].
*  1603   &ndash; [[Tokugawa Ieyasu]] is granted the title of [[shogun]] from [[Emperor Go-Yozei]], and establishes the [[Tokugawa Shogunate]] in [[Edo]], Japan.
*[[1663]] &ndash; The [[Province of Carolina]] is granted by charter to eight [[Lords Proprietor]] in reward for their assistance in [[Restoration (England)|restoring]] [[Charles II of England]] to the throne.
*[[1707]] &ndash; The [[Acts of Union 1707]] is signed, officially uniting the Kingdoms of England and Scotland to create the Kingdom of Great Britain.
*[[1720]] &ndash; Count [[Frederick I of Sweden|Frederick of Hesse-Kassel]] is elected King of Sweden by the [[Riksdag of the Estates]], after his consort [[Ulrika Eleonora, Queen of Sweden|Ulrika Eleonora]] abdicated the throne on 29 February. She had been wanting to rule jointly with her husband in the same manner as [[William and Mary]] in the British Isles, but after the Riksdag of the Estates said no to this, she chose to abdicate the throne in his favour instead.
*[[1721]] &ndash; [[Johann Sebastian Bach]] dedicated six [[concerto]]s to [[Margrave Christian Ludwig of Brandenburg-Schwedt|Christian Ludwig]], [[margrave]] of [[Brandenburg-Schwedt]], now commonly called the [[Brandenburg concertos]], BWV 1046–1051.
*[[1731]] &ndash; ''Naturalization of [[Jerome, 2nd Count de Salis|Hieronimus de Salis]]'' Parliamentary Act is passed.
*[[1765]] &ndash; [[American Revolution]]: The [[Kingdom of Great Britain]] passes the [[Quartering Act]], which requires the [[Thirteen Colonies]] to house [[Armed Forces of the United Kingdom|British]] troops.
*[[1829]] &ndash; [[Catholic Emancipation]]: The Parliament of the United Kingdom passes the [[Roman Catholic Relief Act 1829]], allowing Catholics to serve in Parliament.
*[[1832]] &ndash; In [[Hiram, Ohio]], a group of men beat and [[tar and feather]] [[Mormon]] leader [[Joseph Smith]].
*[[1837]] &ndash; Canada gives [[Black Canadians|African Canadian]] men the right to vote.
*[[1854]] &ndash; In [[Venezuela]], slavery was abolished.
*[[1860]] &ndash; [[Sakuradamon incident (1860)|Sakuradamon incident]]: Assassination of Japanese Chief Minister ([[Tairō]]) [[Ii Naosuke]].
*[[1869]] &ndash; The last of [[Titokowaru]]'s forces surrendered to the New Zealand government, ending [[Titokowaru's War|his uprising]].
*[[1878]] &ndash; The British frigate {{HMS|Eurydice|1843|6}} sinks, killing more than 300.
*[[1882]] &ndash; [[Robert Koch]] announces the discovery of ''[[Mycobacterium tuberculosis]]'', the [[bacterium]] responsible for [[tuberculosis]].
*[[1885]] &ndash; [[Sino-French War]]: Chinese victory in the [[Battle of Bang Bo (Zhennan Pass)|Battle of Bang Bo]] on the [[Tonkin]]–[[Guangxi]] border.
*[[1896]] &ndash; [[Alexander Stepanovich Popov|A. S. Popov]] makes the first radio signal transmission in history.
*[[1900]] &ndash; Mayor of New York City [[Robert Anderson Van Wyck]] breaks ground for a new underground "[[New York City Subway|Rapid Transit Railroad]]" that would link [[Manhattan]] and [[Brooklyn]].
*[[1907]] &ndash; The first issue of the [[Georgia (country)|Georgian]] [[Bolshevik]] newspaper ''[[Dro (Georgian newspaper)|Dro]]'' is published.
*[[1922]] &ndash; [[Irish War of Independence]]: In [[Belfast]], [[Northern Ireland|Northern Irish]] policemen break into the home of a Catholic family and [[McMahon murders|shoot all eight males inside]].
*[[1927]] &ndash; [[Nanking Incident]]: Foreign warships bombard [[Nanjing]], China, in defense of the foreign citizens within the city.
*[[1934]] &ndash; [[United States Congress]] passes the [[Tydings–McDuffie Act]], allowing the [[Philippines]] to become a self-governing [[Commonwealth of the Philippines|commonwealth]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[Ardeatine massacre]]: [[Nazi Germany|German]] troops murder 335 Italian civilians in Rome.
*  1944   &ndash; [[World War II]]: In an event later dramatized in the movie ''[[The Great Escape (film)|The Great Escape]]'', 76 [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] prisoners of war begin breaking out of the German camp [[Stalag Luft III]].
*[[1946]] &ndash; The British [[1946 Cabinet Mission to India|Cabinet Mission]], consisting of [[Frederick Pethick-Lawrence, 1st Baron Pethick-Lawrence|Lord Pethick-Lawrence]], Sir [[Stafford Cripps]] and [[A. V. Alexander, 1st Earl Alexander of Hillsborough|A. V. Alexander]], arrives in India to discuss and plan for the transfer of power from the [[British Raj]] to Indian leadership.
*[[1958]] &ndash; Rock'N'Roll teen idol [[Elvis Presley]] is drafted in the U.S. Army.
*[[1959]] &ndash; The [[Party of the African Federation]] is launched by [[Léopold Sédar Senghor]] and [[Modibo Keïta]].
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[NASA]] spacecraft [[Ranger 9]], equipped to convert its signals into a form suitable for showing on domestic television, brings images of the Moon into ordinary homes before crash landing.
*[[1972]] &ndash; The United Kingdom imposes [[direct rule]] over [[Northern Ireland]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[Kenya]]n athlete [[Kip Keino]] defeats [[Jim Ryun]] at the first-ever professional track meet in [[Los Angeles]].
*[[1976]] &ndash; In [[Argentina]], the armed forces overthrow the constitutional government of President [[Isabel Perón]] and start a 7-year dictatorial period self-styled the ''[[National Reorganization Process]]''. Since 2006, a public holiday known as [[Day of Remembrance for Truth and Justice]] is held on this day.
*[[1980]] &ndash; [[Archbishop]] [[Óscar Romero]] is killed while celebrating [[Mass (Catholic Church)|Mass]] in [[San Salvador]].
*[[1986]] &ndash; The [[Loscoe]] [[gas explosion]] leads to new UK laws on [[landfill gas migration]] and gas protection on [[landfill]] sites.
*[[1989]] &ndash; [[Exxon Valdez oil spill]]: In [[Prince William Sound]] in Alaska, the ''[[Exxon Valdez]]'' spills {{convert|240000|oilbbl|m3}} of [[petroleum]] after running aground.
*[[1993]] &ndash; Discovery of [[Comet Shoemaker–Levy 9]].
*[[1998]] &ndash; [[Westside Middle School massacre|Jonesboro massacre]]: [[Mitchell Johnson and Andrew Golden]], aged 11 and 13 respectively, fire upon teachers and students at Westside Middle School in [[Jonesboro, Arkansas]]; five people are killed and ten are wounded.
*  1998   &ndash; A [[tornado]] sweeps through [[Dantan]] in India, killing 250 people and injuring 3000 others.
*[[1999]] &ndash; [[Mont Blanc Tunnel]] fire kills 39 people.
*  1999   &ndash; [[Kosovo War]]: [[NATO]] commences [[1999 NATO bombing of the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|aerial bombardment]] against [[Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|Yugoslavia]], marking the first time NATO has attacked a sovereign country.
*[[2000]] &ndash; [[S&P 500]] index reaches an intraday high of 1,552.87, a peak that, due to the collapse of the [[dot-com bubble]], it will not reach again for another seven-and-a-half years.
*[[2003]] &ndash; The [[Arab League]] votes 21–1 in favor of a resolution demanding the immediate and unconditional removal of U.S. and British soldiers from [[Iraq]].
*[[2008]] &ndash; [[Bhutan]] officially becomes a [[democracy]], with its [[Bhutanese general election, 2008|first ever general election]].
*[[2014]] &ndash; A [[O'Hare CTA station train crash|train crash]] at [[O'Hare (CTA station)|Chicago O'Hare Airport station]] injures 32 people.
